title: Trey Hollingsworth
added: Hollingsworth was sworn into his first term on January 3, 2017, and his second term on January 3, 2019.

Hollingsworth has promised to serve no more than eight years (four terms) in the House.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.newsandtribune.com/news/u-s-rep-trey-hollingsworth-introduces-term-limits-bill/article_254c9a76-d6be-11e6-9084-53e9ac4d43a1.html |title= U.S. Rep. Trey Hollingsworth introduces term limits bill |author= Elizabeth Beilman, ''News and Tribune'' }}</ref> Government reform, including creating Congressional term limits, has been a priority for him in Congress. In both the 115th and 116th Congress, Hollingsworth introduced a resolution to amend the Constitution to impose term limits on Congressional lawmakers.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://thehill.com/homenews/house/424231-gop-rep-unveils-resolution-seeking-congressional-term-limits|title=GOP rep unveils resolution seeking congressional term limits|last=Nam|first=Rafael|date=2019-01-07|website=TheHill|language=en|access-date=2019-12-30}}</ref> The measure would limit Congressional terms to four terms in the House of Representatives and two terms in the Senate.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-joint-resolution/14|title=H.J.Res.14 - 116th Congress (2019-2020): Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to limit the number of terms that a Member of Congress may serve to four in the House of Representatives and two in the Senate.|last=Hollingsworth|first=Trey|date=2019-01-03|website=www.congress.gov|access-date=2019-12-30}}</ref>

The second focus of Hollingsworth's government reform proposal is a lobbying ban for members of Congress. He has introduced the Banning Lobbying and Safeguarding Trust Act, which would ban members of Congress from ever registering as a lobbyist.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://thehill.com/business-a-lobbying/429604-gop-lawmaker-introduces-bill-to-stop-revolving-door|title=GOP lawmaker introduces bill to stop revolving door|last=Homan|first=Timothy R.|date=2019-02-12|website=TheHill|language=en|access-date=2019-12-30}}</ref>

The third component of Hollingsworth's government reform efforts is spending reform. He believes short-term budgeting wastes taxpayer dollars and therefore has consistently voted against short-term spending bills.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://hollingsworth.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=67|title=Hollingsworth: Congressional Budget Process Failing|date=2017-04-12|website=U.S. Representative Trey Hollingsworth|language=en|access-date=2019-12-30}}</ref>

In December 2017, Hollingsworth voted for the [[Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017]].<ref name="Almukhtar">{{cite web|last1=Almukhtar|first1=Sarah|title=How Each House Member Voted on the Tax Bill|url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/12/19/us/politics/tax-bill-house-live-vote.html?_r=1|website=The New York Times|access-date=December 28, 2017|date=December 19, 2017}}</ref>
